decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing Jori En, Ruin Diver's ability to draw cards whenever you cast your second spell each turn. By efficiently countering and removing threats while drawing cards, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It includes a variety of instant-speed removal spells, counterspells, and card draw effects to help maintain board control and card advantage. With a mix of versatile spells and powerful creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Murktide Regent, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure victory through incremental advantage and tempo plays. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Vedalken Shackles provide additional disruption against certain strategies.

The main goal of this deck is to utilize the powerful reanimation abilities of Old Stickfingers to bring back key combo pieces from the graveyard and win the game through a lethal combination of spells, sacrificing creatures, and controlling the board. The deck aims to generate mana quickly through rituals and land ramp, allowing for explosive plays and setting up combos like Reanimate or Animate Dead to bring back high-impact creatures. With a mix of disruption in the form of hand disruption spells and removal, as well as protection with cards like Defense Grid and Veil of Summer, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own towards a decisive victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to exert control over the game by utilizing counterspells, card draw, and powerful artifacts. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student serves as the commander, providing card advantage and flexibility in casting spells. The deck includes a variety of powerful control cards such as Force of Will, Cryptic Command, and Mystic Confluence to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Artifact cards like Batterskull and Urza, Lord High Artificer provide additional threats and value. The deck also includes various utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary and Academy Ruins to further enhance its control capabilities. Overall, the deck aims to outsmart and outmaneuver the opponent through careful planning and strategic play.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing various creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes a mix of powerful creatures like Tana, the Bloodsower and Yoshimaru, Ever Faithful, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares to control the board. The deck also includes several mana-fixing lands and mana ramp cards to ensure a smooth mana curve and consistent aggression. The inclusion of equipment like Embercleave and Skullclamp enhances the effectiveness of the creatures on the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro strategy, putting pressure on them from the beginning of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game and manipulate the battlefield through a combination of card advantage, disruption, and removal spells. Marchesa, Dealer of Death serves as the commander, providing a powerful engine for recurring threats and generating value. The deck includes a mix of creature threats like Grim Lavamancer and Snapcaster Mage, along with versatile removal spells such as Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt. It also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak to protect its board state. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by efficiently trading resources and outmaneuvering threats, ultimately establishing dominance and closing out the game with its powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Aggro strategy with the commanders Slimefoot and Squee. The key concept revolves around quickly building up a board presence with a combination of fast mana acceleration, efficient creatures, and disruptive spells to maintain control of the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive game plan, utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Grist, the Hunger Tide to deal damage while generating value from sacrificing creatures. Additionally, the deck includes a versatile toolbox of removal spells and tutors to handle different threats and ensure consistent performance. By combining resilience, speed, and synergy, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander setting.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies with a mix of creature beatdown and disruption elements. The commanders, Kodama of the East Tree and Yoshimaru, Ever Faithful, work together to establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. The deck includes a variety of powerful creatures such as Questing Beast, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Skyclave Apparition to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck runs efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude to deal with threats. The mana base is optimized for consistent and fast ramp, with cards like Gemstone Caverns and Verdant Catacombs. Overall, the deck aims to win through aggressive creature combat and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck revolves around utilizing Azusa's ability to play multiple lands per turn to ramp quickly and establish a strong board presence. By running a high density of lands and land-related cards, the deck aims to control the game through land destruction, land tutoring, and land recursion. It also includes a variety of high-impact creatures and spells, such as Primeval Titan and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, to close out the game quickly once the mana advantage is established. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful land plays and threats while disrupting their game plan through control elements.

The deck focuses on ramping quickly and efficiently with cards like Burgeoning, Exploration, and Oracle of Mul Daya, allowing the player to quickly get ahead on mana and play powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck also features a strong land package with cards like Maze of Ith, Thespian's Stage, and Dark Depths to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck has tools for recursion and card advantage with cards like Life from the Loam and Ramunap Excavator, ensuring that the player always has access to their powerful resources. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through powerful land synergies and overwhelming threats.

The main idea of this deck is to control the flow of the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage. Ertai Resurrected is the commander that allows for frequent creature removal and disruption. The deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Demonic Tutor to find key pieces. It utilizes card draw with spells like Brainstorm, Fact or Fiction, and Mystic Confluence to maintain a full hand and stay ahead of opponents. Removal spells such as Damnation, Fatal Push, and Toxic Deluge help clear the board of threats. The deck also has versatile land options to ensure mana availability and provides a mix of win conditions through creatures like Hullbreacher and Torrential Gearhulk.

The main goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, taking advantage of Fury','','');">Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury as the commander to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing a mix of low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react defensively. With a focus on efficient removal and early aggression, the deck aims to maintain board control and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to be fast-paced, proactive, and relentless in its pursuit of victory in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format.

The deck revolves around creating infinite combos with Prossh, Skyraider of Kher and sacrificing creatures to generate tokens and drain opponents' life. It aims to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies while setting up its own win condition through various combos involving cards like Food Chain, Purphoros, God of the Forge, and Goblin Bombardment. The deck includes efficient ramp, tutors, removal, and recursion to ensure consistency and resilience. It focuses on fast mana acceleration and leveraging Prossh's ability to create a threatening board presence quickly, overwhelming opponents with a combination of combo pieces and sacrifice outlets. The deck aims to close out the game swiftly once its combo pieces are assembled.

The main objective of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by countering their spells, bouncing their permanents, and controlling the board through card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and various cheap countermagic spells, the deck aims to prevent the opponent from resolving key threats or spells. Additionally, cards like Brazen Borrower, Vedalken Shackles, and Urza, Lord High Artificer provide additional ways to control the board and generate value. The deck also includes cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage and selection, allowing the pilot to find the answers they need to keep the opponent in check while working towards their win condition.

The main idea of this control deck centered around Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student is to use a variety of counterspells, card draw, and bounce spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing a mix of hard counters like Force of Will and Cryptic Command, along with soft counters like Mana Leak and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to maintain board control and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Vedalken Shackles and True-Name Nemesis provides additional threats and ways to control the battlefield. Overall, the deck's goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful decision-making and strategic play.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The commanders, Tana and Yoshimaru, provide a strong base for the deck with their abilities supporting an aggressive strategy. The deck includes a variety of efficient creatures like Boros Charm, Bonecrusher Giant, and Skyclave Apparition to maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, powerful spells like Lightning Bolt, Swords to Plowshares, and Embercleave offer removal and reach to control the board and close out games. The deck also utilizes lands like Command Tower, Arid Mesa, and Mana Confluence to ensure consistent mana production for casting spells and deploying threats efficiently.
